system.description:
You have carefully studied the power that resides within your blood and in doing so have learned how to leverage it to further destructive ends.

  • You gain your choice of scholar @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-class-features.Item.luapp6zqydhkeemn]{Defensive Studies} if you do not already have one. If you do, or if you take this feat and would later gain one normally from 6th level scholar, you gain the following additional benefits.
    • If you have @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-class-features.Item.okthtwyohmh0eoa5]{Mystic Apprentice}, you can add your intelligence modifier to the damage roll of any cantrip that deals your @UUID[Compendium.a5e-bloody-heretics.bloody-heretics.Item.XuB01Vt0ev8WBOPt]{Sanguine Transference} damage type, and if such a cantrip would require a saving throw from the target instead of making an attack roll your spell save DC gains an expertise die if the target is marked by your @UUID[Compendium.a5e-bloody-heretics.bloody-heretics.Item.as2ADovft2mxBCWa]{Scholar of the Blood} feat.
    • If you chose @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-class-features.Item.v4pkjilh484jph6i]{Precision Strikes}, then treat the bonus damage as one step higher in the progression whenever you use either Sanguine Transference or while under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.a5e-bloody-heretics.bloody-heretics.Item.eSbauOXs2C1ajtDf]{Blood Frenzy}.  In both cases the bonus damage is treated as the damage type from your Sanguine Transference rather than the damage type of the weapon while using this benefit.
    • The temporary hit points granted by your blood frenzy are instead equal to either your Constitution score + your Intelligence modifier or your Intelligence score + your Constitution modifier, whichever is higher.
